SEARCH
Module io.jstach.ezkv.kvs
Package io.jstach.ezkv.kvs

Interface KeyValuesServiceProvider.KeyValuesFilter

All Superinterfaces:
KeyValuesServiceProvider
Enclosing interface:
KeyValuesServiceProvider
public static non-sealed interface KeyValuesServiceProvider.KeyValuesFilter extends KeyValuesServiceProvider
A service provider interface (SPI) for filtering key values after a resource is loaded.

Filters are applied to modify, rename, or remove key-value pairs without altering the original resource. This can be useful for transforming keys to a desired format or eliminating unnecessary entries before the key values are processed further.

Usage

A KeyValuesFilter is invoked after a KeyValuesResource is loaded but before the resulting KeyValues are passed to the next stage of processing. The filter uses a filter name and optional parameters to determine how the key values should be modified.

Filters are enabled by using the KeyValuesResource.KEY_FILTER key where the default syntax is _filter_[resourceName]_[filterId]=expression.

Builtin Filters

grep

Grep will filter keys by a regular expression. If the expression matches any part of the key the key value is included. 

_load_resource=...
_filter_resource_grep=someregex

sed

Sed can change the keys name with subsitution or drop keys altogether. It follows a subset of the UNIX sed command where "s" and "d" are supported commands. 

_load_resource=...
_filter_resource_sed=/match/ s/replace/withme/g

Extensibility

Implementations of KeyValuesFilter can be registered using the provides directive in module-info.java or the META-INF/services mechanism with the fully qualified name of KeyValuesServiceProvider. Ideally the filter only applies filtering based on the passed in filter name. Otherwise it should just return the passed in key values.

For example, to provide a custom implementation: 


 module my.module {
     provides io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesServiceProvider with my.module.MyKeyValuesFilter;
 }

Method Details

The filter(FilterContext, KeyValues, Filter) method performs the filtering operation.

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Interface
    Description
    static final record 
    KeyValuesServiceProvider.KeyValuesFilter.Filter
    A filter description with filter identifier and expression which is the DSL code that the filter will parse use to do filtering.
    static final record 
    KeyValuesServiceProvider.KeyValuesFilter.FilterContext
    Provides contextual information to a filter, including the environment and any parameters specified for the filtering operation.

    Modifier and Type
    Method

    filter(KeyValuesServiceProvider.KeyValuesFilter.FilterContext context, KeyValues keyValues, KeyValuesServiceProvider.KeyValuesFilter.Filter filter)

  • Method Details

    • filter

      KeyValues filter(KeyValuesServiceProvider.KeyValuesFilter.FilterContext context, KeyValues keyValues, KeyValuesServiceProvider.KeyValuesFilter.Filter filter)
      Applies a filter to the given key-value pairs. The filter should ideally only be applied if the passed filter parameter matches (filter name) otherwise the filter just return the passed in key values.
      Parameters:
      context - the filter context providing the environment and parameters
      keyValues - the key-value pairs to be filtered
      filter - filter description
      Returns:
      a new KeyValues instance with the filtered key-value pairs
